Rajat Shinde
About Me

About Me

I am a Masters-PhD (Dual Degree) Student in Geo-informatics and a Prime Minister's Research Fellow (2018) working under the supervision of Prof. Surya S Durbha at the Geocomputational Systems and IoT Group in Centre of Studies in Resources Engineering , IIT Bombay. I have completed my undergraduation in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from National Institute of Technology Raipur in 2016.

I love to play flute and save shots on a goal post while playing football.

My research interests lie at the intersection of 3D computer vision, machine learning, embedded systems, Internet of Things, high performance computing and signal processing. My Masters-PhD topic involves application of Machine Learning for onboard point cloud processing.

Email | Scholar | ORCID | OSGeo | LinkedIn | Twitter | Github

News

  • [September 2019] Took a session on "Earth Engine UI & Web Apps" at the Earth Engine India Student Summit 2019. Thanks to Google Earth Outreach team for organizing this event
  • [August 2019] We successfully orgnanised a workshop on "Building Standards Compliant Geospatial Web Applications – The Quick and Easy MapMint Way" in FOSS4G 2019 conference held in Bucharest
  • [August 2019] First trip to Japan. Attended and presented papers at the IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS 2019) held in Yokohama, Japan
  • [August 2019] Successfully completed the project "EcoViz: A Google Earth Engine based web application for robust visualization of ecological status of selected world heritage sites of the Western Ghats in India" with Nature Conservation Foundation for the Google Summer of Earth Engine Research Program
  • [August 2019] End of the Google Summer of Code 2019. It was a great experience mentoring 2 successful projects along with the MapMint team under the OSGeo organization
  • [July 2019] Webinar on "Hyperparameter Tuning in Google Earth Engine" at the Community on Air Webinar organized by the Google Earth Engine India Community

Projects

  • Google Summer of Earth Engine 2019
    Student developer for Nature Conservation Foundation under the mentorship of Dr. M D Madhusudan
    • Developed EcoViz: A Google Earth Engine based web application for robust visualization of ecological status of selected world heritage sites of the Western Ghats in India

    App | Presentation

  • Earth Engine India Advanced Summit Buildathon 2019
    Worked on "Locating Solar Farms in Selected Sites of India using Google Earth Engine"
    • In a team of 6, implemented random-forest classifier to solve binary classification problem (Solar Farm: 1, Non-Solar farm: 0) with an accuracy of 81%
    • Added Wavelet Kernel-based convolution approach for solar panels texture detection thus improving the accuracy to 83.6%

    Presentation | Code | Buildathon

  • Earthquake Prediction Using Machine Learning Techniques
    • In a team of 4, implemented machine learning models(SVM, ANN, Random Forests & Decision Tree Classifier) obtaining maximum accuracy of 94.5% to predict the earthquake in the Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Sumatra region
    • Extracted features (b-values) from USGS earthquake dataset of the last 26 years to train models

    Report

  • Image Pre-processing using Lee & Gradient-Inverse Kernels
    • Implemented Lee kernel and Gradient-Inverse kernel for satellite image pre-processing
    • Developed a Graphical User Interface (GUI) based application in MATLAB

    Report | Code
